ZipRecruiter.summary: The average entry-level recruiter salary in California is $43,012 per year ($20.68/hour) as of June 2025. Salaries range from $23,686 to $62,668, with the 25th percentile at $35,500 and the 75th percentile at $46,900. Top earners (90th percentile) make about $54,773 annually. The job market is not very active and California ranks 50th in the US for entry-level recruiter salaries.

text_summary: Based on ZipRecruiter data from mid-2025, an entry-level recruiter in California earns on average about $43,000 annually, with most salaries falling between $35,500 and $46,900. The salary range is wide, reflecting differences in skill, location, and experience. Other sources (Salary.com, Indeed, Levels.fyi) did not provide data in the search results.
